articles.title: Zimbabwe Cabinet Backs Bill That Would Extend Mnangagwa's Rule Till 2030
articles.description: US News is a recognized leader in college, grad school, hospital, mutual fund, and car rankings. Track elected officials, research health conditions, and find news you can use in politics, business, health, and education.
articles.content:
HARARE, Feb 10 (Reuters) - Zimbabwe's cabinet backed ‌draft ​legislation on Tuesday that ‌would change the constitution to extend presidential terms ​from five years to seven, allowing President Emmerson Mnangagwa to stay in ‍office until 2030.

articles.title: In Zimbabwe Millions Choose Funeral insurance Over Pricey Medical Cover
articles.description: Planning for death is widely accepted and prioritised rather than costly health insurance in. Zimbabwe
articles.content: Harare : In a striking reflection of economic hardship and shifting social priorities, millions of Zimbabweans are opting for funeral insurance rather than health coverage, a trend that highlights deepening challenges in accessing affordable medical ... [3156 chars]

articles.title: In Zimbabwe, millions choose funeral insurance over pricey medical cover
articles.description: More Zimbabweans are preparing for death than survival as funeral policies are more popular than health insurance.
articles.content:
Harare, Zimbabwe – Ngoni Mutambararo’s uncle, Steward Ganda, 60, spent the last months of his life at home, trying to recover from a severe ailment on his own.
